column5: http://toronto.ctvnews.ca/3-more-asian-grass-carp-found-in-waters-near-toronto-island-1.2546959?hootPostID=80ecd061cdca05f5fbb5fb392fb06843  http://trca.on.ca/news-media/news/releases/211346  It doesn't specify if they were found in lake O.  Scary stuff!
Just read it now. Toronto island harbor. Maybe it's time to breakout the carp gear.
Time to outfit my bow with a reel.
Like back in July , these are Grass Carp, while not a good thing , they are not the silver carp that explode out of the water when boats pass.

Aren't these the same I see swimming around at port credit and bronte?  So what if you catch one? What should you do?  I see the one like in the picture all the time and also something that looks Like carp but more of a silver color I have been noticing lately.
Probably common carp you're seeing Huzz.  If I caught one of the new invasive carp species, I'd keep it and call the MNR.
Still not good sadly but at least they aren't the jumpy super Mario carp.
